With regards to confirmation, I see at least 3 ways of implementing it.

1)=
 Client Side :  The Client simply requires the user to confirm an
action be=
fore the request is sent to the server.

2) Use Transactions : You could us=
e a RESTful style transaction as
defined in "RESTful web services", Basical=
ly create a Transaction
resource first, reference this transaction resource=
 in each of the
operations you perform, If you want to rollback, DELETE the=

transaction resource, or update the transaction resource to show it is
com=
mitted.  

3) Server side : Two Delete requests, The first one changes the =
state
of the resource to awaiting deletion confirmation, A second Deletion
=
request actually deletes the resource.

1 is the easiest and 3 is a little =
mad, I always like to have at least
3 ways of doing anything.
2 is probably=
 the best way to implement this in the service itself.

For simple confirma=
tion I prefer option 1.
